title: Geosystems (Physical Geography) 9th Global 2015 Christopherson
description: COVER: https://i.imgur.com/03xN7ne.jpg TITLE: Geosystems: An Introduction to Physical Geography, 9th edition, Global edition (2015) AUTHOR: Robert W. Christopherson, Ginger E. Birkeland ISBN-13: 9781292057750 BOOK SPECS: http://catalogue.pearsoned.co.uk/educator/product/9781292057750.page FILE SPECS: true PDF, logical page numbers NOT as in the print version, bookmarks, 188 MB, .7z compression DESCRIPTION: Among the most highly regarded in physical geography, Robert Christopherson’s best-selling texts are known for their meticulous attention to detail, currency, accuracy, and rich integration of climate change science. "Geosystems: An Introduction to Physical Geography", 9th Edition, is uniquely organized to present Earth systems topics as they naturally occur: atmosphere, hydrosphere, lithosphere and biosphere. This interconnected and organic systems-based approach is highlighted in the strong pedagogical tools, structured learning path, and up-to-date information found in the text. This new edition presents bold new features that cultivate an active learning environment both in and outside the classroom. BRIEF CONTENTS: --------------- 1 Essentials of Geography PART I The Energy-Atmosphere System 2 Solar Energy to Earth and the Seasons 3 Earth'fs Modern Atmosphere 4 Atmosphere and Surface Energy Balances 5 Global Temperatures 6 Atmospheric and Oceanic Circulations PART II The Water, Weather, and Climate Systems 7 Water and Atmospheric Moisture 8 Weather 9 Water Resources 10 Global Climate Systems 11 Climate Change PART III The Earth-Atmosphere Interface 12 The Dynamic Planet 13 Tectonics, Earthquakes, and Volcanism 14 Weathering, Karst Landscapes, and Mass Movement 15 River Systems 16 Oceans, Coastal Systems, and Wind Processes 17 Glacial and Periglacial Landscapes Part IV Soils, Ecosystems, and Biomes 18 The Geography of Soils 19 Ecosystem Essentials 20 Terrestrial Biomes appendixes glossary index
